newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft stock jumps after earnings report.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft stock jumps after earnings report.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. shares surged Friday, a day after the giant software company reported an 85 percent increase in profit during its most recent quarter.
Microsoft shares traded as high as $104.45 a share in early trading on Nasdaq, up from Thursday's closing price of $98.125.
The surge came in response to Microsoft's earnings report, which was released after the close of trading Thursday and far exceeded Wall Street's forecasts.

Microsoft said it earned $1.04 billion, or 79 cents a share, on record sales of $3.21 billion in its third quarter. Wall Street analysts surveyed by First Call had forecast the company would earn 64 cents a share.

Microsoft's gain contributed to a strong start on the stock market. The technology-laden Nasdaq index was up 10 points at 1,227 in early trading. The Dow Jones industrial average was up 14 points at 6,672.
